intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides var. exiguum, commonly known as the slender bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its slender stems and delicate foliage make it a distinctive species within the genus Bupleurum. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
